title: Prime Minister of South Korea
summary: The prime minister of the Republic of Korea (PMOTROK or PMOSK; Korean: 국무총리; Hanja: 國務總理; RR: Gungmuchongni) is the deputy head of government and the second highest political office of South Korea who is appointed by the president of the Republic of Korea, with the National Assembly's approval. The prime minister may be a member of the National Assembly, but this is not required to hold the office.
